text: The Minas Gerais road crash was a road crash in Lajinha on 21 December 2024. It was located near the district of Teófilo Otoni, Minas Gerais, Brazil, on the BR-116 highway. A passenger bus going on the BR-116 highway from São Paulo to Bahia had a tire problem, causing it to lose control and collide with an oncoming B-double truck at around 4 a.m. local time. A passenger bus, a car and a B-double road train were in the accident. At least 38 people died. == References == *The Guardian Category:December 2024 events Category:2020s in Brazil Category:2020s disasters in South America Category:2024 disasters Category:Transport disasters
